assessments.status_rationale: Today’s coverage indicates heightened U.S. military positioning and planning (e.g., U.S. planes arriving at a Jordan base) and that Trump is considering a limited strike against Iran, but there is no report of a publicly acknowledged U.S. kinetic strike on Iranian territory confirmed by DoD or the White House.
No provided news bullet reports ICE Brent front-month settling at or above $105 on any trading day; no price/settlement evidence is included.
The OpenAI item is about resetting spending expectations and compute targets, not a public announcement of a single financing round with ≥$50B new capital and ≥$800B post-money valuation.
No disclosure is cited (press release/SEC filing/earnings prepared remarks) indicating Nvidia made a direct equity investment in OpenAI totaling at least $10B.
Today’s bullets contain no Bank of Japan policy-meeting decision; the claim spans multiple future meetings through 2026-09-30 and remains unresolved.

The private-credit coverage references liquidity/illiquidity concerns around Blue Owl’s software lending, but it does not clearly state that a ≥$50B AUM U.S.-focused private credit manager announced a redemption gate/suspension/extended notice period explicitly due to withdrawal pressure.
No item indicates OFAC issued a new Russia-related General License/waiver/FAQ expanding permitted U.S.-person transactions in Russia-linked energy/LNG projects.
No news bullet reports the SEC publishing a proposed rule or amendments that specifically increase reporting/disclosure requirements for private credit/private funds.
No provided item reports the NSF announcing a pause/deferral of new grant awards for at least 30 consecutive days due to funding constraints.
